XBPS

Configuration

  1. Set ignored packages:
    /etc/xbps.d/ignore.conf
    ## If package depends on ignored package, the dependecy is always satisfied
## without installing ignored package.
ignorepkg=nvi
ignorepkg=sudo

Package Management

Repositories

  • List installed repositories:

    $ xbps-query -L

  • Install additional repositories1) and synchronize them:

    # xbps-install void-repo-nonfree void-repo-multilib void-repo-multilib-nonfree
# xbps-install -Su xbps ; xbps-install -Su

Install & Remove

  • Update:

    # xbps-install -Su xbps
# xbps-install -Su 
# xbps-remove -o 
# rm -rf /var/cache/xbps/*

  • Install:

    # xbps-install <PACKAGE>

  • Remove:

    # xbps-remove -Ro <PACAKGE>

Mark

  • As automatic (dependency) or manual (explicitly installed):

    # xbps-pkgdb -m <auto|manual> <PACKAGE>

  • To hold (don't update) or unhold (update normally):

    # xbps-pkgdb -m <hold|unhold> <PACKAGE>

Query

  • Installed packages:
    • All packages:

      $ xbps-query -l

    • Manually (explicitly) installed packages:

      $ xbps-query -m

    • Orphaned dependencies:

      $ xbps-query -O

    • On hold packages:

      $ xbps-query -H

    • Matching [remote] packages:

      $ xbps-query [-R] -s <WILDCARD-STRING>

  • Package details:
    • Detailed [remote] package info:

      $ xbps-query [-R] -S <PACKAGE>

    • Files owned by [remote] package:

      $ xbps-query [-R] -f <PACKAGE>

    • Name of package that owns [remote] file(s):

      $ xbps-query [-R] -o <WILDCARD-STRING>

    • Dependencies of [remote] package:

      $ xbps-query [-R] -x <PACKAGE>

    • Packages that given [remote] package is dependency for:

      $ xbps-query [-R] -X <PACKAGE>

1)
Void subrepositories: https://docs.voidlinux.org/xbps/repositories/index.html#subrepositories
